context:
1 Nyquist Server 
Installation 
1
Nyquist Server Installation Options
Two options are available for installing and deploying Nyquist E7000:
1 Using a Nyquist System Controller (NQ-SYSCTRL), which already 
has the operating system and E7000 application software installed 
on it.
2 Using your own server platform and installing the Debian OS and 
E7000 application software. While Option 1 is the quickest and 
easiest approach, Option 2 may be better suited for situations 
where high-availability server features like Redundant Array of 
Independent Disks (RAID) or hot-swappable power supplies are 
desired.
This manual describes the installation steps for Option 2.
Before installing Nyquist, ensure that:
• Required services are enabled on your network. An example of a 
required service includes TFTP.
• Required multicast IP addresses and ports are known and avail-
able.
• Required IP addresses are known and available.
• Required port numbers are open.
Ensure your server meets system requirements before beginning the 
Debian OS installation.
Note: This manual provides the Nyquist E7000 installation process 
when using your own server. If you are using the Nyquist System 
Controller (NQ-SYSCTRL), refer to the Nyquist E7000 System Con-
troller Setup Guide.

qas.question: What are the two installation options for Nyquist E7000?

answers.text: The two installation options for Nyquist E7000 are: 1) using a Nyquist System Controller (NQ-SYSCTRL), which comes with the operating system and E7000 application software pre-installed, and 2) using your own server platform where you install the Debian OS and E7000 application software manually. The first option is quicker and easier, while the second offers more flexibility for high-availability features.

qas.question: Which option is considered the quickest and easiest for installing Nyquist E7000?

answers.text: The quickest and easiest option for installing Nyquist E7000 is using a Nyquist System Controller (NQ-SYSCTRL), which already has the operating system and E7000 application software pre-installed. This option simplifies the installation process compared to using your own server platform.

qas.question: What is a key advantage of using your own server platform for Nyquist E7000 installation?

answers.text: A key advantage of using your own server platform for Nyquist E7000 installation is the ability to implement high-availability server features, such as Redundant Array of Independent Disks (RAID) and hot-swappable power supplies. This setup can enhance system reliability and minimize downtime compared to using the pre-configured Nyquist System Controller.

qas.question: What essential services must be enabled on the network before installing Nyquist?

answers.text: Before installing Nyquist, essential services that must be enabled on the network include TFTP, as well as ensuring that required multicast IP addresses, ports, and IP addresses are known and available. Additionally, required port numbers must be open.

qas.question: Why is it important to know the required multicast IP addresses and ports prior to installation?

answers.text: Knowing the required multicast IP addresses and ports prior to installation is crucial because they are necessary for proper network configuration and communication between devices. This setup ensures that the Nyquist E7000 can effectively interact with other systems and services in the network.

qas.question: What should be verified regarding IP addresses before beginning the installation of Nyquist?

answers.text: Before installing Nyquist, ensure that the required IP addresses are known and available. Additionally, verify that the multicast IP addresses and ports are known and available, along with ensuring that the required port numbers are open.

qas.question: Which specific system requirement should be checked before starting the Debian OS installation?

answers.text: Before starting the Debian OS installation for Nyquist E7000, ensure that your server meets the specified system requirements. These requirements should encompass hardware compatibility, available resources, and network configurations necessary for proper installation.

qas.question: Where can one find the installation instructions if using a Nyquist System Controller?

answers.text: If using a Nyquist System Controller (NQ-SYSCTRL), the installation instructions can be found in the Nyquist E7000 System Controller Setup Guide. This guide contains the specific setup process for the controller.

qas.question: What feature might be desired that is only available when using your own server platform?

answers.text: When using your own server platform, features like high-availability configurations, such as Redundant Array of Independent Disks (RAID) and hot-swappable power supplies, become available. These features enhance system reliability and uptime, making them desirable for critical applications.

If you are updating an existing Nyquist system, read "Best Practices” 
on page 49 and then refer to the update procedure in the Nyquist 
E7000 System Administrator Manual.
1.1
Understanding System Requirements
The E7000 web-based UI requires a secure Hypertext Transfer Proto-
col Secure (https) type network connection to the E7000 system 
server. Users can log in to the E7000 system using the Google 
Chrome web browser from a computer or tablet running either a 
Windows 8.1 (or later) or a Mac OS X 10.12.x (or later) operating 
system (OS). The UI can also be accessed via a Chrome browser 
enabled Android-based tablet or mobile device. To access the server, 
type your server’s IP address (for example, 10.10.20.12).
1.1.1
Whitelisted Web Addresses
E7000 requires access to specific Uniform Resource Locators (URLs), 
commonly referred to as web addresses. Access to many of these 
web addresses is required during installation; access to other web 
addresses, such as the address for the Network Time Server (NTS) are 
required during runtime. The Information Technology (IT) depart-
ment for the site must whitelist the web addresses so that they can 
be easily accessed as needed.
The following table lists the URLs that must be whitelisted.

qas.question: What type of network connection is required for the E7000 web-based UI?

answers.text: The E7000 web-based UI requires a secure Hypertext Transfer Protocol Secure (HTTPS) network connection to the E7000 system server. Users can access the UI using the Google Chrome web browser on compatible operating systems such as Windows 8.1 (or later) or Mac OS X 10.12.x (or later).

qas.question: Which web browsers and operating systems are compatible for logging into the E7000 system?

answers.text: Users can log into the E7000 system using the Google Chrome web browser on a computer or tablet running Windows 8.1 (or later) or Mac OS X 10.12.x (or later). Additionally, the UI is accessible via a Chrome-enabled Android-based tablet or mobile device.

qas.question: What is the purpose of whitelisting specific URLs for the E7000 system?

answers.text: The purpose of whitelisting specific URLs for the E7000 system is to ensure that necessary web addresses for licensing support, software downloads, and system updates are accessible during installation and runtime. This access is crucial for the proper functioning and setup of the system, as required by the Information Technology department.

qas.question: Can you name one URL that is required for E7000 License support?

answers.text: One URL required for E7000 License support is http://hostedactivation.com, specifically the subaddress http://hostedactivation.com/bogen. Access to this URL must be whitelisted by the IT department during installation.

qas.question: Which URL is necessary for downloading sounds from Asterisk?

answers.text: The URL necessary for downloading sounds from Asterisk is http://downloads.asterisk.org/ (specifically, http://downloads.asterisk.org/pub/telephony/sounds/releases). This address must be whitelisted for the E7000 system to function correctly during sound downloads.

qas.question: What server address format should be used to access the E7000 server?

answers.text: To access the E7000 server, type the server's IP address in the format "https://[server IP]" (for example, https://10.10.20.12) using a secure Hypertext Transfer Protocol Secure (https) connection. Ensure you are using the Google Chrome web browser on a compatible operating system.

qas.question: Which web address is needed during Linux package installation?

answers.text: The web addresses needed during Linux package installation are http://ftp.us.debian.org (specifically, http://ftp.us.debian.org/debian/) and http://security.debian.org (specifically, http://security.debian.org/). Access to these URLs must be whitelisted by the IT department.

qas.question: Why might the IT department need to whitelist URLs for the E7000 system?

answers.text: The IT department needs to whitelist URLs for the E7000 system to ensure that necessary resources, such as license support, software downloads, and sound files, are accessible during installation and runtime. This access is crucial for the proper functioning and maintenance of the E7000 system.

qas.question: What type of device, aside from computers, can access the E7000 UI?

answers.text: Aside from computers, the E7000 UI can be accessed via a Chrome browser-enabled Android-based tablet or mobile device. Users need to ensure they are connected to a secure network and can log in using the appropriate web browser.

qas.question: What kind of support is provided through the URL http://downloads.digium.com?

answers.text: The URL http://downloads.digium.com provides essential downloads for the Digium Phone Module for Asterisk (DPMA), which is necessary for integrating Digium phones with the Asterisk telephony system. Accessing this URL is required during the installation process of the E7000 system.

qas.question: What URLs are used during runtime on the E7000 System Parameters page?

answers.text: The URLs used during runtime on the E7000 System Parameters page include the NTS URL (default: pool.ntp.org), the STUN server URL (default: stun01.sipphone.com), and a TURN server URL (not specified). Additionally, other URLs related to warranty support and services are also referenced.

qas.question: What is the default URL for the NTS in the E7000 system?

answers.text: The default URL for the NTS (Network Time Server) in the E7000 system is pool.ntp.org.

qas.question: Which STUN server is recommended for use with the E7000 Web UI?

answers.text: The recommended STUN server for use with the E7000 Web UI is stun01.sipphone.com. This server is required for STUN-based IP address resolution and should be enabled on the computer running the Web UI.

qas.question: What is the minimum OS requirement for the E7000 system server?

answers.text: The minimum OS requirement for the E7000 system server is Debian Linux OS (AMD 64-bit version) release 8.9.0. It is recommended to consult the most up-to-date release notes on the Bogen website for details on tested Linux OS versions.

qas.question: What CPU specifications are required for the E7000 system server?

answers.text: The E7000 system server requires a quad-core Intel-based processor running at 3.0 GHz or higher. This specification ensures adequate performance for the system's operations.

qas.question: What type of RAM is recommended for improved performance and reliability in the E7000 system?

answers.text: Error Correcting Code (ECC) RAM is recommended for improved performance and reliability in the E7000 system. The system requires a minimum of 8 GB of RAM.

qas.question: Which URL is necessary for E7000 warranty support?

answers.text: The URL necessary for E7000 warranty support is http://api.bogenedu.com/api/customers. This URL is listed in the documentation as required for obtaining warranty services for the E7000 system.

qas.question: Are the default URLs for STUN and TURN servers set in the E7000 system?

answers.text: No, the default URLs for the STUN and TURN servers are not set in the E7000 system. The default URL for the NTS is pool.ntp.org, while STUN requires a specified URL, such as stun01.sipphone.com.

qas.question: What is the release version of the Debian Linux OS for the E7000 system?

answers.text: The release version of the Debian Linux OS for the E7000 system is 8.9.0 (AMD 64-bit version). It's recommended to refer to the Bogen Education website for the most up-to-date release notes regarding tested Linux OS versions.

qas.question: What hardware component is specified for the E7000 system server?

answers.text: The hardware component specified for the E7000 system server is a sound card with a microphone port. Additionally, it requires a quad-core Intel-based processor running at 3.0 GHz or higher and 8 GB of Error Correcting Code (ECC) RAM for optimal performance and reliability.

E7000 system server as part of the E7000 installation. All other net-

Disk Storage
One 250 GB disk drive
Some form of hardware-based Redundant Array of Inde-
pendent Disks (RAID) is recommended for redundancy and

Consider using a larger drive if large amounts of audio (for 
example, voice mail, announcements, recordings, and

• How many users will have voicemail ability?
• How long will voicemail messages be stored?
• Will voicemail messages be part of the local system

qas.question: What automatic services are included with the E7000 installation?

answers.text: The E7000 installation automatically includes required application services necessary for the server's operation. However, all other network services must either be already present or installed manually.

qas.question: What is recommended for achieving redundancy and high availability for disk storage?

answers.text: It is recommended to use some form of hardware-based Redundant Array of Independent Disks (RAID) for achieving redundancy and high availability in disk storage. Additionally, consider using a larger drive if storing large amounts of audio data.

qas.question: How does the file format (WAV vs. MP3) impact storage requirements for audio files?

answers.text: WAV files are typically larger than MP3 files because WAV is a lossless format that preserves the full audio quality, while MP3 is a lossy format that compresses audio data, resulting in smaller file sizes. Therefore, if large amounts of audio such as voicemail, announcements, and recordings are stored, opting for MP3 format can significantly reduce storage requirements.

qas.question: What considerations should be taken into account regarding backup frequency?

answers.text: When considering backup frequency for the E7000 system server, it's important to evaluate how often backups will be performed and whether they will be stored locally or remotely (e.g., on a detachable drive, SAN/NAS, or NFS). Additionally, factors such as the number of voicemail users and the retention period for voicemail messages should be assessed, as these influence the volume of data to be backed up.

qas.question: Where can backups be stored: locally or remotely?

answers.text: Backups can be stored locally on a detachable drive or remotely on a Storage Area Network (SAN), Network Attached Storage (NAS), or a Network File System (NFS). The choice depends on the organization's backup strategy and infrastructure.

qas.question: How many users are anticipated to use the voicemail feature?

answers.text: The document does not specify an exact number of users anticipated to use the voicemail feature. It encourages consideration of the number of users when planning for disk storage and backup needs related to voicemail services.

qas.question: What is the duration for which voicemail messages will be retained?

answers.text: The duration for which voicemail messages will be retained is not explicitly stated in the provided context. Factors that influence this duration include how long the organization decides to keep messages based on their backup and storage policies.

qas.question: Will voicemail messages be included in local system backups?

answers.text: The inclusion of voicemail messages in local system backups is dependent on the specific backup strategy implemented. Consideration should be given to whether voicemail messages will be part of the local system backups during your planning process.

qas.question: What type of Ethernet connectivity is offered by the NIC?

answers.text: The Network Interface Card (NIC) offers 10/100/1000 MB Ethernet connectivity, allowing for data transfer rates of up to 1 Gbps. This supports various network applications and ensures efficient communication within the system.

qas.question: What types of telephony interfaces might be necessary beyond SIP trunking?

answers.text: Beyond SIP trunking, necessary telephony interfaces may include Foreign Exchange Office (FXO) and Foreign Exchange Subscriber (FXS) interface cards. These interfaces facilitate connectivity to traditional analog phone lines and devices, enabling a broader range of telephony options.

qas.question: How many PCI/PCIe expansion slots are required for additional telephony network connectivity?

answers.text: One or more PCI/PCIe expansion slots are required for additional telephony network connectivity beyond SIP trunking. The specific number of slots needed depends on the telephony hardware requirements, which can be determined by consulting a Bogen Dealer.

qas.question: What is the purpose of the Apache service in the network application services?

answers.text: The Apache service serves as the web server for the E7000 web interface, enabling access and interaction with the system through web-based applications. It is classified as a mandatory service for the E7000 location.

qas.question: Which service is mandatory for the E7000 web interface?

answers.text: The mandatory service for the E7000 web interface is Apache, which serves as the web server. Additionally, NTP is also mandatory for the E7000 system server, providing date/time synchronization.

qas.question: What does DHCP stand for and what is its role in the network?

answers.text: DHCP stands for Dynamic Host Configuration Protocol. Its role in the network is to supply dynamic IP addresses to the E7000 system server and associated devices, enabling them to connect effectively while also providing the TFTP server IP address or hostname via option_66.

qas.question: Is the DNS service mandatory or optional in the network configuration?

answers.text: The DNS service is optional in the network configuration. It resolves host names to IP addresses but is not required for the E7000 system to function.

qas.question: What services are associated with ICE, STUN, and TURN in the network?

answers.text: ICE, STUN, and TURN are services used to resolve IP addresses behind Network Address Translation (NAT) or firewalls, facilitating connectivity in real-time communication applications. These services are optional and can be deployed on either the E7000 or the network.

qas.question: What type of synchronization does NTP provide for the E7000 system?

answers.text: NTP (Network Time Protocol) provides date and time synchronization for the E7000 system server and associated devices, such as IP phones and appliances. This ensures that all devices on the network maintain consistent and accurate time.

qas.question: Where is the DHCP service required according to the table?

answers.text: The DHCP service is required at the Network location, as indicated in the table. It supplies dynamic IP addresses to the E7000 system server and associated devices.

qas.question: What does DNS resolve in the context of network services?

answers.text: In the context of network services, DNS (Domain Name System) resolves host names to IP addresses. It serves as a hierarchical naming system that allows for the identification and location of computers, servers, or other resources on either the Internet or a private network.

qas.question: How does the configuration of the E7000 respond to the availability of NTP?

answers.text: The configuration of the E7000 mandates the use of NTP for date and time synchronization, ensuring that the system server and associated devices maintain accurate time. This is crucial for the proper functioning of time-sensitive applications and communications. If NTP is not available, the system may experience issues with time-dependent operations.

qas.question: What is the significance of option_66 in the DHCP service configuration?

answers.text: Option_66 in the DHCP service configuration is used to supply the Trivial File Transfer Protocol (TFTP) server's IP address or host name to devices on the network. This allows network devices to locate and connect to the TFTP server for necessary file transfers, enhancing their functionality and configuration.

qas.question: What protocol does the E7000 Linux server use to provide statistics?

answers.text: The E7000 Linux server uses Simple Network Management Protocol (SNMP) v1 to provide statistics. This service operates through Port 161.

qas.question: Through which port does SNMP v1 operate on the E7000 server?

answers.text: SNMP v1 operates on the E7000 server through Port 161. This port is used for providing statistics via the Simple Network Management Protocol.

qas.question: What port is used by the TFTP server on the E7000 system?

answers.text: The TFTP server on the E7000 system uses port 69, which is the standard TFTP port. Device provisioning files are stored in the directory /srv/tftp on the server.

qas.question: Where are device provisioning files stored on the E7000 system server?

answers.text: Device provisioning files on the E7000 system server are stored in the directory: /srv/tftp. This is the only directory exposed by the TFTP server running on port 69.

qas.question: Is the TFTP service mandatory or optional for the E7000 system?

answers.text: The TFTP service is mandatory for the E7000 system as it is used for IP phone and device provisioning. The TFTP server operates on port 69, and provisioning files are stored in the /srv/tftp directory.

qas.question: What is the only directory exposed by the TFTP server on the E7000?

answers.text: The only directory exposed by the TFTP server on the E7000 is /srv/tftp. This directory is used for storing device provisioning files.

context:
2 Installing Debian 8.xx.x 
AMD 64
7
Installing Debian 8.xx.x AMD 64
Before beginning the install process, make sure that your Nyquist 
E7000 system server can access the URLs, or web sites (see 
"Whitelisted Web Addresses” on page 2, from a Chrome browser).
You must install the Debian OS on the Nyquist E7000 system server 
before you can install the Nyquist E7000 application software. The 
Debian OS can be installed by either using a graphical user interface 
(GUI) or a command line interface (CLI).
2.1
Installation Using the CLI
To install Debian 8.xx.x AMD 64 bit using the CLI:
Step 1
Insert a bootable media into the computer. The boot-
able media can be a DVD, a CD, or a flash drive.

8
The inital Debian install screen appears.
Step 2
From the Debian GNU/Linux Installer Boot Menu, select 
Install and then press Enter.
You will be prompted to select localization options that 
will be used for both the installation and for the 
installed system. These localization options include lan-
guage and location.The default language is English.
Step 3
Select a language and then press Enter.

9
Step 4
Select your location and then press Enter.
This selection is used to set your time zone.
You are next prompted to select a keyboard configura-
tion. Keyboards are often tailored to the characters 
used in a language.

10
Step 5
Select the keyboard that you want to use and then 
press Enter.
Step 6
When prompted for the hostname, type debian, select 
Continue, and press Enter.

11
Step 7
Type the domain name or leave this field blank if you 
are using an IP address. Then, select Continue and 
press Enter.
Step 8
Enter the password for the root, or system administra-
tive account. Note that this password should contain a 
mixture of letters, numbers, and special characters and 
that you should record this password as you will need 
it when installing Nyquist.
Step 9
When prompted, re-enter the password and press 
Continue.
Step 10
Type the full name of a user who will perform nonad-
ministrative activities on the server. Then, select Con-
tinue.

12
Step 11
Type a user name for the new account and select Con-
tinue.
Step 12
When prompted, enter a password for this user and 
select Continue.
Step 13
When prompted, re-enter the password and select 
Continue.
Step 14
Select your time zone and then press Enter.
Step 15
Select Guided - use entire disk and press Enter to 
begin partitioning the disk.
Note: While you can select a different partitioning scheme or select 
to manually partition the disk, the next few steps use the Guide - 
use entire disk option. You can later review and customize the 
results.

13
 
Step 16
Select the disk that you want to partition and press 
Enter.
Step 17
Select the partitioning scheme that you want to use. If 
you are uncertain as to which scheme would be best, 
select All files in one partition (recommended for 
new users).
Step 18
Press Enter.
Note: All data on the selected disk will be erased.

14
Step 19
When prompted, select Finish partition and write 
changes to disk and then press Enter.
Step 20
Select Yes to write changes to the disks and then press 
Enter.

15
Step 21
When prompted, select an archive mirror country and 
then press Enter.
Step 22
Select a Debian archive mirror and then press Enter.
Step 23
When prompted to configure the package manager, 
leave the proxy field blank and press Enter.

16
Step 24
When prompted to participate in the survey, select 
either Yes or No and press Enter.
Step 25
Select the software that you want to install. As a mini-
mum, select GNOME, Web Server, SSH Server, and 
Standard System Utilities.
Step 26
Select Continue and press Enter.
Step 27
When prompted to install the GRUB boot loader on a 
hard disk, select Yes and then press Enter.
The boot loader allows your server to launch the 
Debian OS when powered on.

17
Step 28
When prompted to select the hard disk where the 
bootable software is to reside, Enter device manually 
and then press Enter.
Step 29
When prompted that the installation is complete, make 
sure to remove the installation media, select Continue, 
and press Enter.
The server boots into the new system and displays the 
GUI. You can now install the Nyquist software applica-
tion.

qas.question: What type of media can be used to boot the Debian installation?

answers.text: The Debian installation can be booted using a DVD, a CD, or a flash drive as the bootable media.

qas.question: What is the default language set during the installation process?

answers.text: The default language set during the installation process of Debian 8.xx.x is English. Users can select a different language if desired, but English is the pre-selected option.

qas.question: How do you specify the hostname during the Debian installation?

answers.text: During the Debian installation, you specify the hostname when prompted by typing "debian" and then selecting Continue. This occurs after selecting your keyboard configuration and before entering network details.

qas.question: What type of password is required for the root user account?

answers.text: The password for the root user account must contain a mixture of letters, numbers, and special characters. It is important to record this password, as it will be needed for installing the Nyquist software.

qas.question: How should you choose the partitioning scheme if you are uncertain?

answers.text: If you are uncertain about the partitioning scheme during the Debian installation, it is recommended to select "All files in one partition," as this option is ideal for new users. This choice simplifies the installation process by placing all system files in a single partition.

qas.question: What happens when you select "Finish partition and write changes to disk"?

answers.text: When you select "Finish partition and write changes to disk," the installer will proceed to apply the partitioning scheme you selected, erasing all data on the chosen disk. This step finalizes the disk layout and prepares it for the installation of the Debian OS.

qas.question: Which software packages are recommended for installation at a minimum?

answers.text: At a minimum, it is recommended to install the following software packages: GNOME, Web Server, SSH Server, and Standard System Utilities.

qas.question: What is the function of the GRUB boot loader in the Debian installation?

answers.text: The GRUB boot loader is responsible for launching the Debian operating system when the server is powered on. It ensures that the system can initiate the boot process and load the operating system from the designated hard disk.

qas.question: What must be done after the installation is complete before booting into the new system?

answers.text: After the installation is complete, you must remove the installation media before selecting Continue to boot into the new system. This ensures that the server starts up using the newly installed Debian OS.

3 Installing the Nyquist 
E7000 System 
31
Installing the Nyquist E7000 
System Server
The Nyquist system server install involves the following tasks:
• Setting up a static IP address for the Nyquist E7000 server
• Copying and extracting the nyquist-e7000-xx.xx.xx.xxxx.tar.gz file
• Installing the Nyquist E7000 application software
Before installing Nyquist E7000, you must install the Debian OS (see 
"Installing Debian 8.xx.x AMD 64” on page 7). 
3.1
Setting Up Static IP Address
Before setting up a static IP address, determine the vacant IP address 
that you want to implement in your environment. Then, back up the 
interface file and edit the original interface file to include this IP 
address.

32
To set up a static IP address:
Step 1
Log into the Linux desktop.
Step 2
From the menu on the top right of the screen, select 
the Settings/Tool icon.

33
Step 3
Select Users.
Step 4
Select Unlock.

34
Step 5
Type the root password and then select Authenticate.
Step 6
Select Account Type and select Administrator. Then, 
select Lock and select the Back icon.

35
Step 7
From the All Settings screen, select Network.
Step 8
Select the Settings icon, which is shaped like a gear, on 
the lower right of the screen.

36
Step 9
Enter the IPv4 address settings and then click Apply. 
Next toggle the ON/OFF button to OFF and then to ON 
to apply the network settings.
Step 10
Go to Activities, launch the Firefox browser, and verify 
Internet access.

Prior to these steps, the Debian OS must be installed.

qas.question: Which operating system needs to be installed prior to setting up the Nyquist E7000?

qas.question: What is the first step in setting up a static IP address for the Nyquist E7000 server?

answers.text: The first step in setting up a static IP address for the Nyquist E7000 server is to log into the Linux desktop. After logging in, you need to determine the vacant IP address you want to implement in your environment and back up the interface file before editing it.

qas.question: How do you unlock user settings on the Linux desktop?

qas.question: What type of account must be selected to configure network settings?

3.2
Copying and Extracting the .tar File
The <nyquist-e7000-xx.xx.xx.xxxx.tar.gz> file is a compressed archive 
file that must be copied to the server and then extracted. For this file, 
xx.xx.xx must be replaced by the Nyquist version number. This version 
number can be obtained by typing the following at the shell prompt: 
ls nyquist-*
To copy and extract the <nyquist-e7000-xx.xx.xx.xxxx.tar.gz> file:
Step 1
Copy the Nyquist installer tar file to a USB drive and 
plug the drive into a USB port on the Linux server.
Note: The Nyquist server must have access to the Internet in order 
to complete this procedure.

37
The server displays a dialog box when the USB drive is 
plugged in.
Step 2
Select Open with Files..
Step 3
Right-click File and select Copy To.
.
Step 4
Select Computer in the left column, click the tmp 
folder, and then click the Select button in the upper 
right hand corner.

38
Step 5
Click the Terminal icon to start a Command Line Inter-
face, or CLI, session.
Step 6
Type su at the command prompt, press Enter, and then 
type the root password.
Step 7
To extract the tar file, type cd /tmp to change the 
directory to the tmp file and then type the tar 
extraction command:
tar xPvf nyquist-<nyquist version>.tar.gz
You can also type part of the file name and then press 
the Tab key. The rest of the file name will fill in.
The file will begin extracting.

qas.question: What is the purpose of the <nyquist-e7000-xx.xx.xx.xxxx.tar.gz> file?

answers.text: The <nyquist-e7000-xx.xx.xx.xxxx.tar.gz> file is a compressed archive containing the Nyquist installer for the e7000 version. It must be copied to a Linux server and extracted to install the Nyquist software.

qas.question: How can you determine the Nyquist version number?

answers.text: You can determine the Nyquist version number by typing the command `ls nyquist-*` at the shell prompt. This will list the available Nyquist files, allowing you to identify the version number from the filename.

qas.question: What step must be completed before copying the Nyquist installer tar file to the Linux server?

answers.text: Before copying the Nyquist installer tar file to the Linux server, the file must be copied to a USB drive, which should then be plugged into a USB port on the server. Additionally, the Nyquist server must have Internet access to complete the installation procedure.

qas.question: What action should be taken after plugging the USB drive into the server?

answers.text: After plugging the USB drive into the server, select "Open with Files.." when prompted. Then, right-click the Nyquist installer file and choose "Copy To," selecting the tmp folder on the server to paste the file.

qas.question: Which menu option should you select to access the contents of the USB drive?

answers.text: To access the contents of the USB drive, select "Open with Files.." from the dialog box that appears when the USB drive is plugged in. This will allow you to view and manage the files on the drive.

qas.question: What is the purpose of selecting the 'tmp' folder in the copy process?

answers.text: The purpose of selecting the 'tmp' folder in the copy process is to provide a temporary storage location for the Nyquist installer tar file on the Linux server. This allows for easy access and management of the file during the extraction process.

qas.question: How do you initiate a Command Line Interface (CLI) session on the server?

answers.text: To initiate a Command Line Interface (CLI) session on the server, click the Terminal icon. Once the terminal opens, type `su`, press Enter, and then enter the root password to gain access.

qas.question: What command is used to switch to the root user in the terminal?

answers.text: The command used to switch to the root user in the terminal is `su`. After typing `su`, you need to press Enter and then enter the root password to gain root access.

qas.question: Which directory should you change to in order to extract the tar file?

answers.text: You should change to the `/tmp` directory to extract the tar file. Use the command `cd /tmp` before executing the extraction command.

qas.question: What command is used to extract the contents of the tar file, and what is the additional functionality of the Tab key in this context?

answers.text: The command used to extract the contents of the tar file is `tar xPvf nyquist-<nyquist version>.tar.gz`. In this context, the Tab key can be used to autocomplete the file name, allowing the user to type part of it and then fill in the rest by pressing Tab, which simplifies the input process.

When prompted to select option (C)reate (E)nter,

When prompted to select option (I)P Address or 
(D)omain name, type i.
Step 10
Type the server’s IP address, and then press Enter.

It looks like you already have a Nyquist system installed: 2.0.0.528

Update  - Use this option to re-install the software to release: 2.0.0:528
------
 * Nyquist software will be re-installed, while preserving user data.
 * All Configuration data will be preserved.
 * Uploaded tones/alarms/announcements will be preserved.

 * Voicemail recordings will be preserved.

Please enter your choice (Enter: Install or Update)?

system and keeps all of your already configured data (for example, 
schedules or station). If you enter Install, the new Nyquist version 
overwrites your existing version and all of your current configuration 
data is deleted.

qas.question: What happens to the user data if the "Install" option is selected?

answers.text: If the "Install" option is selected, the Nyquist software will be fresh-installed, resulting in the deletion of all user data, including configuration data, uploaded tones, songs, playlists, recordings, voicemail recordings, and Call Detail Records (CDRs). However, system backups will be preserved and available after installation.

qas.question: Will system backups be preserved during an "Update"?

answers.text: Yes, system backups will be preserved during an "Update." The update process retains all user data, including configuration data, uploaded content, and recordings.

qas.question: What is the difference between the "Install" and "Update" options for the Nyquist software?

answers.text: The "Install" option performs a fresh installation of the Nyquist software, resulting in the deletion of all user data, configuration data, and uploaded content. In contrast, the "Update" option reinstalls the software while preserving all user data, configurations, and uploaded items.

qas.question: Which types of data are deleted when choosing the "Install" option?

answers.text: When choosing the "Install" option, the following types of data are deleted: user data, all configuration data, uploaded tones/alarms/announcements, uploaded songs and playlists, recordings, voicemail recordings, and Call Detail Records (CDRs). However, system backups will be preserved and available after installation.

qas.question: Is it possible to keep recorded files when updating the Nyquist software?

answers.text: Yes, it is possible to keep recorded files when updating the Nyquist software. Choosing the "Update" option preserves all user data, including recordings, while re-installing the software. In contrast, selecting "Install" will delete all recorded files and configuration data.

qas.question: How many options are available for proceeding with the installation of Nyquist software?

answers.text: There are two options available for proceeding with the installation of Nyquist software: "Install" and "Update." Choosing "Install" will fresh-install the software and delete all user data, while "Update" will re-install the software, preserving all existing user data and configurations.

qas.question: What version of the Nyquist system is currently installed according to the prompt?

qas.question: What happens to Call Detail Records (CDRs) when the "Install" option is chosen?

answers.text: When the "Install" option is chosen, all Call Detail Records (CDRs) will be deleted. This option performs a fresh installation of the Nyquist software, which results in the loss of all user configuration data and uploaded content.

5 Best Practices
49
Best Practices
This section details recommendations and best practices to use when:
• Updating the Nyquist E7000 system server software to a new soft-
ware release
• Re-installing a previous Nyquist software release
• Re-installing the same Nyquist software release
• Updating Nyquist appliance firmware (computer software stored 
on the appliance)
• Using System Backups
5.1
Updating Nyquist Software
New Nyquist server software may include patches to address known 
issues or new releases that provide additional features. The latest 
E7000 server software can be accessed from the secured ES Dealers 
website: 
Note: Before configuring or using any Nyquist appliances, you 
must ensure that the appliance firmware is updated to the latest 
release. The latest firmware release can be obtained from the 
secured ES Dealers website: http://www.bogenedu.com/nyquist-
secure-dealer-resources/
Note: Before beginning the install process, make sure that your 
Nyquist system server can access the required URLs or web sites 
(see "Whitelisted Web Addresses” on page 2 from a Chrome 
browser.

qas.question: What is the primary purpose of updating the Nyquist E7000 system server software?

answers.text: The primary purpose of updating the Nyquist E7000 system server software is to incorporate patches that address known issues and to introduce additional features. Ensuring that the appliance firmware is also up to date is crucial for optimal configuration and usage.

qas.question: Where can the latest E7000 server software be accessed?

answers.text: The latest E7000 server software can be accessed from the secured ES Dealers website at http://www.bogenedu.com/nyquist-secure-dealer-resources/. Additionally, ensure that your Nyquist system server can access the required URLs listed in the documentation before starting the installation process.

qas.question: What must be done before configuring or using Nyquist appliances?

answers.text: Before configuring or using Nyquist appliances, it is essential to ensure that the appliance firmware is updated to the latest release. The latest firmware can be obtained from the secured ES Dealers website.

qas.question: How can one obtain the latest firmware release for Nyquist appliances?

answers.text: The latest firmware release for Nyquist appliances can be obtained from the secured ES Dealers website at http://www.bogenedu.com/nyquist-secure-dealer-resources/.It is important to update the appliance firmware to the latest release before configuring or using any Nyquist appliances.

qas.question: Why is it important to ensure web access to specific URLs before installation?

answers.text: Ensuring web access to specific URLs before installation is important because the Nyquist system server needs to connect to these sites to download necessary software updates, patches, or additional features. Lack of access could prevent successful installation and functionality of the system.

qas.question: What type of issues might new Nyquist server software patches address?

answers.text: New Nyquist server software patches may address known issues such as bugs, security vulnerabilities, and system performance problems. They can also provide enhancements to existing features and resolve compatibility issues with other software or hardware components.

qas.question: In what scenarios would one need to re-install a previous Nyquist software release?

answers.text: One would need to re-install a previous Nyquist software release if a new update introduces issues or bugs that impact system functionality, or if specific features from the earlier version are required that are not present in the latest release. Additionally, reverting may be necessary if compatibility problems arise with existing hardware or software configurations.

qas.question: What is the importance of using system backups in the context of Nyquist systems?

answers.text: Using system backups for Nyquist systems is crucial as they ensure that data and configurations are preserved and can be restored in the event of software updates, reinstalls, or failures. This practice helps maintain system integrity and minimize downtime, allowing for a quicker recovery process.

5.1.1
Assigning Permissions for New Features
After a new software release is installed, permissions for features 
introduced by this new release must be set for the roles that will use 
these features. 
To assign permissions for these new features:
Step 1
On the navigation bar, select Roles.
Step 2
On the Roles page, select the Permissions icon next to 
the role that you want to edit permissions for.
Step 3
On the Edit Permissions page, make desired changes.
Step 4
Select Save.
For more information, refer to the Nyquist E7000 System Administra-
tor Manual.
Note: System backups created by older versions of the server soft-
ware are not compatible with the newer releases and should not be 
used to restore configuration data.

qas.question: What is the recommended method for updating to a new Nyquist server software release?

answers.text: The recommended method for updating to a new Nyquist server software release is to use the Admin Web UI to perform a system update, unless directed otherwise by technical support. This process ensures that all configuration data, call detail records, recordings, and other important elements are retained after the update.

qas.question: What types of data are retained during a system update?

answers.text: During a system update, all configuration data, call detail records, recordings, voice mail, and uploaded announcements, alarms, tones, and songs are retained. This ensures that these files remain accessible after the update.

qas.question: What steps are involved in performing a system update using the Admin Web UI?

answers.text: To perform a system update using the Admin Web UI, first select "System Parameters" from the navigation bar, then choose "System Update," locate the System Update file, and select "Import." It is important to complete the server system update process before updating the Nyquist appliance software.

qas.question: When should permissions for new features be assigned after a software release?

qas.question: How can a user edit permissions for roles in the Nyquist system?

qas.question: What should be noted regarding system backups created by older versions of the server software?

answers.text: System backups created by older versions of the server software are not compatible with newer releases and should not be used to restore configuration data. This is important to ensure system stability and integrity after a software update.

5.2
Re-installing an Earlier Software Release
If you want to re-install an earlier software release, you should first do 
a fresh install of the Debian software. Then, install Nyquist using the 
install_nyquist command (see "Installing the Nyquist Software” on 
page 39).
After the installation completes, you can restore user configuration 
data from a system backup provided the system backup was created 
from the same release that is now installed.
Nyquist appliance software may also need to be re-installed to a pre-
vious release to maintain compatibility with the E7000 system server.

If you need to re-install the same software release, you should first 
perform a system backup. (Refer to the Nyquist E7000 System Admin-
istrator Manual.)
Next, install Nyquist using the install_nyquist command (see "Install-
ing the Nyquist Software” on page 39).
After completing the software installation, restore user configuration 
data from the system backup. 
Note: Before beginning the install process, make sure that your 
Nyquist system server can access the required URLs or web sites 
(see "Whitelisted Web Addresses” on page 2 from a Chrome 
browser.

same Nyquist server software release that is currently running.

It's important to perform a fresh install of the Debian software and then install Nyquist before restoring the configuration data.

qas.question: Why might Nyquist appliance software need to be re-installed to a previous release?

qas.question: What is the first step before re-installing the same software release of Nyquist?

answers.text: Before re-installing the same software release of Nyquist, you should first perform a system backup. This backup is crucial to restore user configuration data after the installation.

qas.question: Which command is used to install Nyquist after performing a system backup?

qas.question: When restoring configuration data, what condition must the system backup meet?

System backups with descriptions that contain "OLD:" and "(for older 
release!)" should not be used to restore configuration data to the 
currently running software release. System backups are automatically 
marked as OLD when a System Update is performed to update the 
Nyquist server software to a new release.
You can use Recordings and Voicemail backups to restore record-
ings and voicemail on any Nyquist software release. These type of 
backups are not dependent on any specific release version (unless 
otherwise stated by Bogen on specific software releases).
5.4
Updating Appliance Firmware
The firmware for all devices used with the E7000 system must be 
compatible with the software installed on the E7000 server, and all 
Nyquist appliances in a given installation should be configured to run 
the same version firmware.
Nyquist application firmware releases can be accessed from the 
secured ES Dealers website: 
http://www.bogenedu.com/nyquist-secure-dealer-resources/
Firmware can be updated for E7000 stations and Analog Station 
Bridge (ASB) devices through the Admin Web UI or through the 
appliance’s web UI. For information about the appliance’s web UI, 
refer to the device’s configuration manual.
Through the E7000 Admin Web UI, you can upload a firmware file to 
the E7000 system server, download firmware to a station or ASB, view 
a list of stations and ASBs that are linked to a firmware name, set 
default firmware for any stations and bridge devices to be added, and 
delete firmware entries. For information about using the Admin Web 
UI, refer to the Nyquist E7000 System Administrator Manual.
Note: Before configuring or using any Nyquist appliances, you 
must ensure that the appliance firmware is updated to the latest 
release. The latest firmware release can be obtained from the 
secured ES Dealers website: http://www.bogenedu.com/nyquist-
secure-dealer-resources/

qas.question: What should not be used to restore configuration data to a currently running software release?

answers.text: System backups with descriptions that contain "OLD:" and "(for older release!)" should not be used to restore configuration data to the currently running software release. These backups are marked as OLD when a System Update occurs to a new software release on the Nyquist server.

qas.question: When are system backups marked as OLD?

answers.text: System backups are marked as OLD automatically when a System Update is performed to update the Nyquist server software to a new release. These backups contain descriptions that include "OLD:" and "(for older release!)" and should not be used to restore configuration data to the currently running software release.

qas.question: Are recordings and voicemail backups dependent on specific software release versions?

answers.text: Recordings and voicemail backups are not dependent on any specific software release versions for the Nyquist system, unless explicitly stated by Bogen for particular software releases. They can be restored on any release.

qas.question: What must be compatible with the software installed on the E7000 server?

answers.text: The firmware for all devices used with the E7000 system must be compatible with the software installed on the E7000 server. Additionally, all Nyquist appliances within a given installation should be configured to run the same version of firmware.

qas.question: Where can Nyquist application firmware releases be accessed?

answers.text: Nyquist application firmware releases can be accessed from the secured ES Dealers website: http://www.bogenedu.com/nyquist-secure-dealer-resources/. It is important to ensure that all Nyquist appliances are configured to run the same version of the firmware compatible with the E7000 server software.

qas.question: How can firmware be updated for E7000 stations and ASB devices?

answers.text: Firmware for E7000 stations and Analog Station Bridge (ASB) devices can be updated through the Admin Web UI or the appliance’s web UI. Users can upload firmware files, download firmware to devices, and manage firmware settings via the E7000 Admin Web UI. The latest firmware releases can be accessed from the secured ES Dealers website.

qas.question: What functionalities can you perform through the E7000 Admin Web UI regarding firmware?

answers.text: Through the E7000 Admin Web UI, you can upload a firmware file to the E7000 system server, download firmware to a station or Analog Station Bridge (ASB), view linked stations and ASBs, set default firmware for new devices, and delete firmware entries. Ensure that the appliance firmware is updated to the latest release before configuration or use.

qas.question: What should be ensured before configuring or using any Nyquist appliances?

answers.text: Before configuring or using any Nyquist appliances, it is essential to ensure that the appliance firmware is updated to the latest release. This ensures compatibility with the software installed on the E7000 server and that all Nyquist appliances are running the same firmware version.
